questions.question: What is a characteristic of Scrum methodology?
answers: Ad hoc planning of project tasks

questions.question: What do functional user requirements typically describe?
answers: How some computations must be carried out

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the software requirements document?
answers: To provide a design blueprint for developers
To define user requirements and system specifications
To detail how the system should accomplish its tasks
To document the software testing procedures
questions.correct_ans: To define user requirements and system specifications

questions.question: What does SDLC stand for?
What component of Software Quality Assurance is involved in detecting programming errors?
Which phase of the project life cycle focuses on specifying system requirements in detail?
What should a complete requirements document include?
Which software development methodology emphasizes iterative and incremental development?
What is the purpose of version control systems like Git
answers: To create backups of software projects
To track changes in code and collaborate with others on development
questions.correct_ans: To track changes in code and collaborate with others on development

questions.question: What does MVC stand for in the context of software architecture?
What is the purpose of a software requirements specification (SRS) document?
answers: To document the internal design of the software
To specify the functionality, performance, and design constraints of the software
To outline the marketing strategy for the software product
To provide user documentation for the software
questions.correct_ans: To specify the functionality, performance, and design constraints of the software

questions.question: Which software development methodology focuses on delivering working software in short iterations and adapting to change
What's the primary goal of integration testing
What's another term for black-box testing?
What's a software design pattern's main purpose?
What type of testing ensures all components work together?
What is the primary difference between functional and non-functional requirements?
answers: Functional requirements define system services, while non-functional requirements define system constraints
Functional requirements define system constraints, while non-functional requirements define system services.
Functional requirements are written for customers, while non-functional requirements are written for developers
Functional requirements focus on system behavior, while non-functional requirements focus on system properties and constraints
questions.correct_ans: Functional requirements focus on system behavior, while non-functional requirements focus on system properties and constraints

questions.question: What is the primary objective of black-box testing
answers: To test individual components of the system
To test the overall system functionality
To test system performance under load
To test the system against predefined specifications without knowledge of its internal structure
questions.correct_ans: To test the system against predefined specifications without knowledge of its internal structure

questions.question: What is a characteristic of Scrum methodology?
answers: Ad hoc planning of project tasks

questions.question: In Scrum, who is responsible for prioritizing the items in the product backlog?
What distinguishes the software requirements document from a design document?
answers: The software requirements document specifies what the system should do, while the design document specifies how it should do it
The software requirements document includes technical details, while the design document focuses on user requirements
The software requirements document is updated frequently, while the design document remains static
The software requirements document outlines the development process, while the design document outlines the system architecture
questions.correct_ans: The software requirements document specifies what the system should do, while the design document specifies how it should do it

questions.question: How are requirements and design interconnected in software development?
answers: Requirements and design are separate phases with no overlap
Requirements dictate the system architecture, while design specifies the system's functionality
Requirements drive the system architecture and design decisions
Design precedes the establishment of requirements in the development process
questions.correct_ans: Requirements drive the system architecture and design decisions

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a burn-down chart in Scrum?
answers: To track the amount of time spent on each task during a sprint
To visualize the progress of work completed versus work remaining in a sprint
To assign tasks to team members based on their availability
To document the backlog items that have been completed in a sprint
questions.correct_ans: To visualize the progress of work completed versus work remaining in a sprint

questions.question: What is the difference between black-box and white-box testing?
answers: White-box testing focuses on internal code structures, while black-box testing focuses on external functionality
White-box testing only involves manual testing, while black-box testing involves automated testing
White-box testing is conducted by end-users, while black-box testing is conducted by developers
White-box testing is only applicable to frontend testing, while black-box testing is applicable to both frontend and backend testing
questions.correct_ans: White-box testing focuses on internal code structures, while black-box testing focuses on external functionality

questions.question: How are design and implementation activities typically interleaved in software engineering?
answers: Design and implementation are separate phases with no interaction
Design decisions are made after the implementation phase to ensure compatibility
Design and implementation activities are closely linked and often overlap
Implementation precedes the design phase to expedite development
questions.correct_ans: Design and implementation activities are closely linked and often overlap

questions.question: what is the primary role of software architecture in the software design process?
answers: To document the internal design of the software system
To specify the functionality, performance, and design constraints of the software
To provide a design blueprint for developers
To define user requirements and system specifications
questions.correct_ans: To specify the functionality, performance, and design constraints of the software

questions.question: How does the first stage of the software design process contribute to establishing system boundaries?
answers: By identifying and defining the external interactions with the system
By determining the programming language to be used for implementation
By documenting the testing procedures for the software
By selecting the hardware infrastructure for the software system
questions.correct_ans: By identifying and defining the external interactions with the system

questions.question: What is the primary objective of a burn-down chart in Scrum methodology?
answers: To track the amount of time spent on each task during a sprint
To assign tasks to team members based on their availability
To document the backlog items that have been completed in a sprint
To visualize the progress of work completed versus work remaining in a sprint
questions.correct_ans: To visualize the progress of work completed versus work remaining in a sprint

questions.question: In white-box testing, what does the term code coverage refer to?
answers: The number of test cases executed
The percentage of code lines executed during testing
The depth of nested if-else statements in the code
The amount of code written by each developer
questions.correct_ans: The percentage of code lines executed during testing
